result.execSummary:
The defendant Kothar C Bishop was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Referred to the mental health unit of probation.
Take all prescribed medication.
No new retail theft tickets.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kothar C Bishop

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded as to Count Two: 

 Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for zero days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for TWO YEARS, to commencment after the completion of count one ,with the following conditions:
*referred to the mental health unit of probation
*take all prescribed medication
*pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during probation or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant
*no new retail theft tickets

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Sentencing proceeded AS TO COUNT ONE:  

 The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 7 MONTHS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  NO Huber privileges. Sentence will be served in the Wisconsin State Prison system. Court ordered all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges waived due to low income.

Defendant Kothar C Bishop in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Kothar C Bishop in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This case is being heard for branch 24. 

As to Counts ONE AND TWO: 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Kothar C Bishop not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court grants ONE FINAL ADJOURNMENT to allow the defendant time to obtain a valid license.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Kothar C Bishop not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

JUDGE PROTASIEWICZ, BRANCH 24 WILL NOT BE IN SESSION ON MAY 21, 2015.  CASE RESCHEDULED TO JUNE 10, 2015 AT 8:30 AM.  PLEASE NOTIFY YOUR CLIENT OF THE CHANGE.  IF THIS DATE IS INCONVENIENT, PLEASE CONTACT THE CLERK AT 414-278-4775 TO RESCHEDULE.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Kothar C Bishop not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with WALMART STORE, W. SILVER SPRING DR.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION including DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Kothar C Bishop in court with attorney Gabriela A. Leija.  Defendant Kothar C Bishop in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
